BasicTheory.Title: The Musical Alphabet
BasicTheory.Description: The musical alphabet consists of 7 letters: A, B, C, D, E, F, G. These letters represent the basic pitches used in music.

BasicTheory.Title: Staff, Clefs, and Notes
BasicTheory.Description: The staff is a set of five horizontal lines and four spaces.Clefs indicate the pitch range of the notes on the staff.Notes are symbols placed on the staff to represent the duration and pitch of a sound.

BasicTheory.Title: Scales
BasicTheory.Description: Major scale: C-D-E-F-G-A-B-C.minor scale pattern is W-H-W-W-H-W-W.

BasicTheory.Title: Intervals
BasicTheory.Description: Intervals are the distances between two notes, measured in steps.

BasicTheory.Title: Chords
BasicTheory.Description: Major Chords: Consist of the three chords(e.g., C-E-G).Minor Chords: Consist of the chords(e.g., C-Eâ™­-G).

BasicTheory.Title: Chord Progressions
BasicTheory.Description: I-IV-V: For example, in the key of C major, this would be C-F-G. ii-V-I: For example, in the key of C major, this would be Dm-G-C.

BasicTheory.Title: Time Signatures
BasicTheory.Description: 4/4: Four beats per measure. 3/4: Three beats per measure.6/8: Six beats per measure

BasicTheory.Title: Rhythm and Meter
BasicTheory.Description: Rhythm: The pattern of sounds and silences. Meter: The grouping of beats into regular patterns.

BasicTheory.Title: Dynamics and Articulations
BasicTheory.Description: Dynamics: Indicate the volume of the music.Articulations: Indicate how notes should be played
